pros: The pros for having this entry level position at a nursing home is to get a hands on approach on how this area of the medical field operates. Ive also got exposed to many different kinds of patients with different diagnoses. Working with great people in a team and meeting new people everyday is what i liked most about this job.
cons: The cons about this position is simply one thing. Management was terrible in providing training to their new employees and expected you to know procedures about every part of the job. They failed to provide me with decent training.

review_title: Overall good place to work for.
pros: Good work environment and the residents are expected to receive great care by the management. Usually always rated a 5 star facility. The job is union with good benefits. Starts out at $14.57 an hour plus experience.
cons: workplace drama, he said/she said stuff all the time. Management doesn't always take care of disagreements between co-workers. Management doesn't always listen to concerns made by employees.

pros: Good place to work if you like to work extra hours.  Organization is well run. Pay is good and benefits are excellent.  Holiday pay is excellent.
cons: Shift mandation. Nurse patient ratio is a little  to high
